Design - Getting Started
FitHome
  • Home
  • About
  • Tech
  • Posts
  • Contact

Download

A homeowner downloads the FitHome app from either the Apple App Store or Google Play store.

Start Membership

Upon launching FitHome, the homeowner is shown the member registration screen. If there are monitors available, the homeowner is shown the Start Training screen.
.
If there is a waitlist, the homeowner is shown the waiting list sign up screen.

Geographic Location

Whichever screen is shown, the homeowner is made aware of the limited geographic availability of the FitHome experience. The limit is to make sure the homeowner will have a quality experience since there are a few places where personalized interactions are part of the experience, for example, when an electrician comes out to install the monitor.

Supported Zip Codes

The FitHome experience ends here for a homeowner that does not find their zip code listed. If their zip code is listed, they continue with the following….

Enter Registration Information

The homeowner enters member registration information and then taps on either the “START TRAINING” or “JOIN WAITING LIST” buttons.

Start Training

Firebase Entries

After tapping “START TRAINING”, the app uses the email and password to create an account in the Firebase account database.

The app creates a node in the Firebase db where the node name is the user id. The node contains additional fields collected on the Start Training screen.
Note: At this point the machine name is not in the entry. The machine name is added by member services when assigning the monitor. #### Firebase Alerts When the entry is created, a notification and text message is sent to FitHome member services. This alerts FitHome member services to assign a monitor.

Assign Monitor

Changing the state of the app to “Start Training” notifies FitHome member services of the need to assign a monitor to the homeowner. FitHome member services:

  • Enters the monitor’s machine name as a key / value.

The name of the monitor is entered as a key/value within the node created by the homeowner within the Firebase db.

Monitor Installation

The next screen helps the homeowner schedule a 1/2 hour appointment for an electrician to come out and install the monitor at available dates and times. Once the appointment has been chosen and “SCHEDULE ELECTRICIAN” button has been tapped, the date/time is removed from the available times. The electrician is notified and scheduled. The app lets the homeowner know the appointment has been made. A text is sent to the home owner within 24 hours of the appointment.

The homeowner either mails or sends a text to us. We email/text back:

1) a “contract” to sign that states the homeowner will commit to one month of FitHome Personal Electricity Savings Training.
2) a request for additional information, explaining why we need it:

  • email address (used to create a membership)
  • home address (needed by the electrician to install the monitor)
  • contact phone/text number (needed to exchange info from us to the member)

3) letting them know an electrician will be contacting them to install the energy monitor.

2

We:

  • Assign an energy monitor to the homeowner.
  • Make a pre-member entry into the Firebase RT db.

  • Contact the electrictian. We give the electrician the homeowner’s address, contact info, energy monitor, and Current Transformers.
  • We contact the homeowner to let them know an electrician will be contacting them.

3

The electrician:

  • Contacts the homeowner and arranges a date/time for an in-home visit to install the energy monitor in the homeowner’s circuit panel.
  • Installs the energy monitor.
  • Works with the homeowner to connect the energy monitor to the home’s wifi.

Once the energy monitor is installed and connected to the home’s wifi, it starts sending power readings to the Firebase RT db. One weeks worth of readings are taken prior to the start of the FitHome member’s 3 week personal training session.

4

The homeowner:

  • (4.1) Installs and launches the FitHome app on their smartphone.
  • (4.2) Creates a Member account by entering their email and a password. Note: The email must be the same email given to us earlier.
  • (4.3) Verifies the homeowner is getting data on their app by viewing the impact screen.

During this time, the app shows the Impact Screen. However, the Analysis and Leaderboard screen aren’t available. They show a countdown of how much time is left before their FitHome session begins. By starting with a week’s worth of data, we can personalize electricity savings advice based on how they currently use electricity.
